column4: I am trying to make an audio cd from MP3s using Brasero. When I try to select a MP3 it tells me ""mp3 file name" is not suitable for audio or video media." Any ideas why?
- without the quotes obviously, try taking out the underscores and dashes (_-) i know this seems pretty weird but try it and tell me how it goes...
- rename it with something that you would recognise it by
- try calling it something with just letters for example "filename.mp3"
- hmm.. not sure what to suggest give me a minute
fyi I can play the mp3 its not a codec issue that I have been able to find out.
- remind me, are you trying to burn the files to a cd ?
- okay, in a terminal type sudo apt-get install k3b
- k3b is another burning tool, its simple to use and can be found under apps
- ahh good sorry i couldnt help, what was your problem so if it happens to me i know how to avoid ;P
it was a codec issue after all. I was able to play the file but not burn it. I just had to install ubuntu-restricted-extras it is now going to attempt to burn with orginial file names.
- ahh okay, usually it is a codec issue at least its sorted now
I know first thing I tried was to try and play the file but it gave me noise
